intro: Borreria petraea, commonly known as the rock borreria, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, often clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Borreria petraea is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
